info.title: AllDebrid API
info.description: OpenAPI 3.1 specification for the AllDebrid API v4. This specification provides comprehensive documentation of all available endpoints, including detailed request/response schemas, authentication methods, and error codes.

tags.name: System
tags.description: System endpoints for connectivity testing and general information

tags.name: Authentication
tags.description: PIN-based authentication flow for generating API keys

tags.name: Hosts
tags.description: Information about supported file hosting services and their availability

tags.name: User
tags.description: User account management, information, and settings

tags.name: Links
tags.description: Link unlocking, information retrieval, and download generation

tags.name: Library
tags.description: User link library for saving and managing links

AllDebridErrorCode.description: Liste exhaustive des codes d'erreur AllDebrid (janvier 2026)

partialList.description: True si la liste est partielle (pas assez de vouchers pré-générés disponibles)

get.description: Public endpoint for testing API connectivity and availability. Does not require authentication. Returns a simple 'pong' response to confirm the API is reachable.

Generates a 4-character PIN code for user authentication. The user must visit the provided URL and enter the PIN to authorize the application. The PIN expires after 10 minutes. Use the 'check' value with /pin/check to poll for user confirmation and retrieve the API key.

Polls the PIN status to check if the user has authorized the application. Returns 'activated: false' while waiting for user confirmation. Once the user enters the PIN on the AllDebrid website, returns 'activated: true' with the API key that should be used for all subsequent authenticated requests.

Retrieves the complete list of supported file hosting services (hosts), streaming platforms, and redirector services. Returns detailed information including domains, regex patterns, status, quotas, and limits for each service. This is a public endpoint that does not require authentication.

200.description: Détails des hôtes, streams et redirectors

get.description: Returns a simplified list of supported domains for hosts, streaming services, and redirectors. This endpoint provides just the domain names without additional metadata, useful for quick domain validation. Public endpoint that does not require authentication.

Returns hosts ordered by their priority/capacity. Lower numbers indicate higher priority. This information helps determine which hosts have better availability or fewer restrictions. Public endpoint that does not require authentication.

Retrieves detailed information about the authenticated user's account including username, email, premium status, subscription details, remaining quotas, fidelity points, and active notifications. Essential for checking account status and available features.

Returns the list of file hosting services available to the authenticated user based on their subscription tier (free or premium). Includes user-specific quota information, download limits, and current usage for each host. Use this to determine which hosts the user can access.

post.description: Checks the email verification status for security verification when logging in from a new location. Returns 'waiting' while pending user confirmation, 'allowed' once verified with a new API key, or 'denied' if rejected. The token parameter is obtained during the login flow.

Resends the verification email to the user's registered email address. Use this when the user hasn't received the initial verification email or if it has expired. Can only be called if the verification status indicates it's resendable.

Clears a specific user notification by its code. Notifications appear in the user info response and inform about account events, quota warnings, or system messages. Use this to mark notifications as read/acknowledged.

Retrieves metadata information for one or more file hosting links without unlocking them. Returns filename, file size, host information, and any errors. Useful for validating links and displaying file information before downloading. Supports password-protected links.

Extracts the actual file hosting links from a redirector/link protector service. Redirectors hide the real download links behind an intermediate URL. This endpoint resolves the redirector and returns the real links that can then be unlocked with /link/unlock.

Unlocks a file hosting link and generates a direct, high-speed download URL. This is the core debrid functionality. Returns immediately with a download link for most hosts. For some hosts, returns a 'delayed' ID that requires polling with /link/delayed. Supports password-protected links and may include streaming options for media files.

Retrieves a specific streaming quality variant for a media file. When unlocking a video link, multiple streaming options may be available (different resolutions/formats). Use the 'id' from the unlock response and the 'stream' identifier to get the direct link for the desired quality.

data.filename: Rick Astley - Never Gonna Give You Up (Video).360.mp4

post.description: Polls the status of a delayed download link. Some file hosts require processing time before the download link is ready. When /link/unlock returns a 'delayed' ID, use this endpoint to check the generation status. Returns status 1 (processing), 2 (ready with link), or 3 (error).

Uploads one or more magnet links or torrent URIs for processing. AllDebrid will download the torrent and make the files available for direct download. Returns immediately with magnet IDs and ready status. If ready=true, files are immediately available. Otherwise, poll /magnet/status for progress. Premium users only.

Uploads one or more .torrent files (binary torrent files) for processing. Alternative to magnet links when you have the actual torrent file. Accepts multipart/form-data with torrent files. Returns torrent information and magnet IDs for tracking. Premium users only.

Retrieves the status of magnets with two operation modes:

**Standard Mode**: Get status of all magnets, a specific magnet by ID, or filter by status (active, ready, expired, error). Returns complete magnet information including download progress, speed, and file details.

**Live Mode**: Enable efficient polling by providing 'session' (random identifier) and 'counter' (starts at 0, increments each call) parameters. In live mode, only magnets that changed since the last call are returned, significantly reducing bandwidth usage. The response includes an updated 'counter' value to use in the next request. Ideal for real-time monitoring of torrent download progress.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: **Standard Mode**: Get status of a specific magnet by its ID. Incompatible with Live Mode parameters.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: **Standard Mode**: Filter magnets by status. Possible values: 'active', 'ready', 'expired', 'error'. Incompatible with Live Mode parameters.

parameters.name: session
parameters.description: **Live Mode**: Random session identifier (e.g., random number between 1-1000000) to track delta updates across requests. Required for Live Mode, must be used with 'counter' parameter.

parameters.name: counter
parameters.description: **Live Mode**: Counter starting at 0 for the first request, then use the 'counter' value returned in the response for subsequent requests. Required for Live Mode, must be used with 'session' parameter.

post.description: Retrieves the complete file tree structure for one or more ready magnets. Returns file names, sizes, and direct download links for each file in the torrent. Files are organized in a hierarchical structure mirroring the original torrent layout. Only works for magnets with ready status.

Permanently deletes a magnet from your account. This removes the torrent from your magnet list and frees up a magnet slot. The files may remain cached on AllDebrid servers but will no longer be associated with your account. Cannot be undone.

Restarts one or more magnets that have failed or stalled. This requeues the torrents for processing and attempts to download them again. Useful for handling temporary errors or magnets that stopped downloading. Can accept multiple magnet IDs to restart in batch.

get.description: Retrieves all links saved to the user's personal library. The saved links feature allows users to bookmark file hosting URLs for later access. Returns link URL, filename, size, save date, and host information for each saved link.

post.description: Saves one or more file hosting links to the user's personal library for later access. This bookmarks the links without unlocking them. Useful for organizing links you want to download later. Supports batch operations with multiple links at once.

Removes one or more links from the user's saved links library. This permanently deletes the bookmarks (not the actual files). Useful for cleaning up your library. Supports batch deletion of multiple links at once.

get.description: Retrieves the user's recent download history - links that have been successfully unlocked in the past 3 days. This is automatically maintained by AllDebrid and provides a quick way to re-access recently downloaded files. Limited to the most recent entries.

post.description: Clears the entire download history for the user. This removes all records of recently unlocked links from the history. Cannot be undone. The actual downloaded files remain accessible if you have the direct links, but the history list will be empty.

get.description: Retrieves the current balance (in euros) for a reseller account. Reseller accounts can generate premium voucher codes that can be sold or distributed. This endpoint shows how much credit remains available for generating new vouchers. Only available for authorized reseller accounts.

post.description: Generates new premium voucher codes by debiting the reseller balance. Each voucher code can be redeemed for AllDebrid premium access for the specified duration (15, 30, 90, 180, or 365 days). Returns the generated codes, price per voucher, total cost, and remaining balance. Maximum 10 vouchers per request. Only available for authorized reseller accounts.

Retrieves pre-generated voucher codes from the reseller's inventory without generating new ones. This endpoint fetches vouchers that were previously generated and are available in stock. If fewer vouchers are available than requested, returns a partial list with 'partialList: true'. Does not debit the reseller balance. Maximum 10 vouchers per request. Only available for authorized reseller accounts.
